fields.label: Content Block Editor
fields.name: c-content-blocks
fields.instructions: Design your page using custom designed content blocks. You have a variety of blocks you can use, and you can arrange what order they appear on a page.

sub_fields.label: Featured Story
sub_fields.name: c-featured-story-card
sub_fields.instructions: Only one featured card allowed. Story must include featured image, title and an except.

sub_fields.label: Featured Stories, Visual Style
sub_fields.name: c-featured-story-block-visual-style
sub_fields.instructions: Choose the visual style for your featured story block.

sub_fields.label: Display Style
sub_fields.name: c-blog-posts-display-style
sub_fields.message: Toggle yes to format list in card style.

sub_fields.label: Standfirst
sub_fields.name: c-intro-standfirst
sub_fields.instructions: A "standfirst" is an introductory paragraph in an article, printed in larger or bolder type or in capitals, that summarizes the article.

sub_fields.label: Lede
sub_fields.name: c-intro-lede
sub_fields.instructions: A "lede" is the introductory section of a news story that is intended to entice the reader to read the full story.

sub_fields.label: Cards
sub_fields.name: c-card-list
sub_fields.instructions: Cards are a popular UI pattern on the web. Each card represents its own singular thought.

sub_fields.label: Heading and Summary
sub_fields.instructions: If you need to add a heading and a summary to introduce this card block. Usually unnecessary, but still optional

sub_fields.label: School Cards
sub_fields.name: c-school-card-list
sub_fields.instructions: Each card represents a department or program at the division.

sub_fields.label: School Card Summary
sub_fields.name: c-school-card-summary
sub_fields.instructions: This field can display degrees or short summary of your program.

sub_fields.label: Stat Block
sub_fields.name: c-stats-block-list
sub_fields.instructions: Stat blocks, Stat bars, Factoids and Rankings are elements that include large number value and a description and horizontal or vertical bars on one side. It can be static or a link. Stat bars are similar to Stat Blocks but wider. Factoids are used for statements that don't begin with a prominent number or symbol ($, %). Rankings are used for statements that do begin with a prominent number or symbol ($, #).

sub_fields.label: Metric Unit
sub_fields.name: c-stats-block-metric
sub_fields.instructions: Put %, km or unit of measurement here.
